snippet: What appears to be widespread support for an overhaul of the corporate tax system may be a veneer covering deep splits between businesses that get the breaks and those that don’t.
abstract: Broad bipartisan support has emerged to overhaul United States' corporate tax system, but campaign will face stiff opposition from lobbyists; proponents would like to lower official rate from 35 percent and end taxation of multinational corporations abroad, but move would require elimination of lucrative loopholes that several industries see as their lifeblood.
lead_paragraph: What appears to be widespread support for an overhaul of the corporate tax system may be a veneer covering deep splits between businesses that get the breaks and those that don’t.

headline.seo: Shaky Agreements Over Fixing the Corporate Tax System
